body.p:
G. W. NORTON, President.
M. B. MORTON, Cashier
Southern Bank of Kentucky,
Russellville, 27 May 1861.
Govr B. Magoffin
Dear Sir:

Your telegram is just now (8 ock P. M) delivered to me and I write by this mail authorizing Cashr Barret to place sixty-thousand dollars to the credit of the State subject to your drafts to pay for arms and munitions of War to put Kentucky in a position of self defense.
The board promptly responded to your demand feeling the utmost Confidence in the ability and prudence of your action and the prompt recognition of the same by the legislature at the Called Session --

Very Truly, Yours
G, W Norton
